ygData.subject: Re: Area Songs in Lguk [WAS:Does CHR affect Largos?
ygData.msgSnippet: ... When we were first exploring lower guk, back when there was 8-10 ppl in the zone, I used lullaby at least once on an over pull in the undead tower. It
ygData.messageBody:
On Thu, Mar 17/88, Sylly Songsynger <jgs@...> wrote:
> From: "Sylly Songsynger" <jgs@...>
>
> Why would you want to play AE songs? What songs are you talking about?
>
> If you are in Guk without an enchanter, you are probably the person who will
> need to do crowd control. So, if (or more like when) you get more than one
> mob, you will be doing Pixie strike. If you have an enchanter, you will not
> want to use AE and break the mobs out of their messed states (ok, Largos
> does not break enchanter mez so that is one option.)

When we were first exploring lower guk, back when there was 8-10 ppl in
the zone, I used lullaby at least once on an over pull in the undead
tower. It worked and we all lived.

>
> In lower Guk, I'd think you would want to buff your tanks: chant and
> celerity or anthem and elemental if you are fighting casters. If you are in
> a situation with multiple mobs and no crowd control, that is a problem. And
> playing area effect damage songs is not the solution.

Another time we had an over pull (again in the undead tower) and I fired
up screech to try to get 4 mobs off our druid so he could get off an
evac. The train that came back 15 sec later with the feared frogs was
the scariest I'd seen there. We got all the gargoyles and every other
frog in the tower too. Heh. Didn't last too long.


--
Artificial Intelligence stands no chance against Natural Stupidity.
